brand.name: Big W
brand.ethicalInfo1: Big W does not have adequate policies on greenhouse gas emissions and there is no evidence it provides a living wage for its workers
brand.ethicalInfo2:
Big W is owned by Woolworths Ltd.

Its environment rating is 'not good enough'. It does not use eco-friendly materials and it does not offer any warranties or repair programs on its products but it is taking steps to minimise the use of packaging. It measures and reports on its direct and indirect emissions and has set an absolute greenhouse gas target. There is no evidence it is taking adequate steps to minimise or eliminate hazardous chemicals in its supply chain. It has water reduction initiatives but has not set any specific reduction targets.

Its labour rating is 'not good enough' based on the 2017 Ethical Fashion Report. This looks at criteria including payment of a living wage, transparency and worker empowerment. It received the top score for its Supplier Code of Conduct included in its supplier contracts. It traces most of its supply chain including all of its final stage, most of its inputs and some or none of its raw material stages. It may publicly list some of its suppliers and it ensures that no subcontracting occurs or that all subcontracted production adheres to code standards. It audits only a small portion of its traced facilities over a two-year period and has minimal worker empowerment initiatives across its supply chain. It has made little to no progress towards paying a living wage across its supply chain.

Its animal rating is 'it's a start'. It uses wool and leather without specifying its sources. It does not use fur, angora, down or exotic animal skin or hair.

Big W is rated 'Not Good Enough' based on information from the 2017 Ethical Fashion Report and our own research.
brand.positiveText: Dear Big W, I love the style and features of your products, and also that you care about people, the planet and animals. Good On You!
brand.negativeText: Dear Big W, I love the style and features of your products, but I'm concerned about the impact of your brand on workers, the environment and animals. Until you do better I'll be looking for alternative brands that meet my needs.
